metadata.title: CVE-2023-2008 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's udmabuf device driver. The specificflaw exists within a fault handler. The issue results from the lack ofproper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in a memoryaccess past the end of an array. An attacker can leverage thisvulnerability to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code in thecontext of the kernel.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2008` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-48-generic - 5.15.0-48.54
linux-image-5.15.0-48-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-48.54
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-48-generic - 5.15.0-48.54
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-48-generic-64k - 5.15.0-48.54
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-28-generic - 5.19.0-28.29~22.04.1
linux-image-5.19.0-28-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-28.29~22.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-48.54').
linux-hwe-5.19 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-28.29~22.04.1').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1018.22').
linux-aws package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1020.24').
linux-azure package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1020.25').

linux-lowlatency package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-48.54').

linux-raspi package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1015.17').
